John Körtner

About

I am a PhD student at the IDHEAP in Lausanne under the supervision of Giuliano Bonoli and Rafael Lalive. I am interested in how caseworkers use information from predictive algorithms. Before starting my PhD, I worked as a data scientist and graduated with a MSc from the University of Konstanz.

Research

Predictive Algorithms in the Delivery of Public Employment Services
with Giuliano Bonoli, In Research Handbook of Labour Market Policy in Rich Democracies, D. Clegg and N. Durazzi (eds.), Edward Elgar Publishing, forthcoming.

Teaching

Artificial Intelligence in the Implementation of Public Policies
Master PMP, IDHEAP
with Giuliano Bonoli, Tobias Mettler, and Omar Ballester.
